Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the photos are from a campaign rally in March, before face masks were recommended by federal health officials.
Understate: The claim understates the context of the photos by not mentioning the timing and circumstances in which they were taken.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to prove that Biden and Harris are not abiding by public health recommendations regarding face masks, as it only relies on out-of-context photos.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the problematic assumption that the absence of masks in the photos implies that Biden and Harris are not following public health guidance.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider the alternative explanation that the photos were taken before face masks were recommended and that Biden and Harris have since advocated for their use.
